fields.description:
Hello,\\
I have configured my domain's CNAME record www.ownroof.ru to point to bitbucket.org. It pings right but the domain does not resolve.\\
Should I do something else except the instruction How to set up a CNAME for your Bitbucket Account?

Thanks,\\
Maria
fields.summary: A problem with a custom domain

fields.description:
I have 2 repository (i.e  A, Bug_A)\\
I created my issues in A repository, now i want to move issues into Bug_A repository.

how can i do this?
fields.summary: Issue tracker

fields.description:
By guessing repository names, anyone can discover the names of someone's private repos. For example, my user, gavinwahl, has a private repo named {{private-repo}}. By visiting [https://bitbucket.org/gavinwahl/private-repo] this can be confirmed, because the page returns a redirect to the login page. I do not have a private repo named 'foo', and you know this because [https://bitbucket.org/gavinwahl/foo] returns a 404.

It should not be possible to gain _any_ information about a user's private repositories. By using different behavior for repositories that exist or don't, anyone can learn whether a specific repository name exists or not.
fields.summary: Private repository names are discoverable

fields.description:
When you rename/move a page inside the wiki all your old links become dead ends! The wiki needs a redirect feature like mediawiki's: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect.

This feature could also be useful for synonymous terms, like "Setup" and "Install".
fields.summary: Redirects for Wiki Pages (BB-7080)

fields.description: The result is that the user may see a timeout and a 500 page for a file list in the source browser.
fields.summary: Browsing a directory listing with many binary files can time out (BB-7074)

fields.description:
With the new version the command lecture doesn't work anymore. The problem is that the label is not processed in the right way. Only the first two letters of the label are read, the remaining letters produce a new frame.

I tried to put several different lectures into one file - which is very uncomfortably for me, because I use beamer for my hole courses - but the failure is stable.
fields.summary: failure with lecture command in Beamer version 3.25

fields.description:
I have two accounts. One account is for my firm's projects and next one is for my private projects. But I can not add SSH key from my macbook to my private account. Can I use one key for two accounts?\\
It show me this error:\\
Someone has already registered that SSH key.
fields.summary: one SSH Key for two accounts

fields.description:
If I have a wiki page which has periods in the page title (e.g. "abc.def.ghi"), then the following happens:\\
a) I save the page. It saves properly.\\
b) In the home page I can create a link to this page and navigate to it.\\
c) Now in this wiki page, if I hover the mouse over the edit button, it OMITS the last fragment of the page name i.e. ".ghi" from the page name in the link. Hence if I click the edit button, it displays the message "Oops, it looks like that file doesn't exist".

It looks like that any fragment of the page name after the LAST period is being omitted.
fields.summary: Wiki Page naming issue

fields.description:
Hi Tom,

I am using ArcGIS Viewer for Flex 2.4 and ArcGIS Server 10. Will this widget work for me??? If so, how do i download a compiled version? I am a little confused with this site, I have never used it before.

Thanks\\
Harriet
fields.summary: Download for Flex Application

fields.description: When forking a repo the fork sometimes doesn't come out of the 'cloning' state. Problem is at that point you're stuck, because you can't delete the repo and try again.
fields.summary: Repository remains in cloning state

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a suggestion. I have quite a few repos. And each of them have different access rules so in general I dont use groups. But it is very difficult to see who has access to what. it would be great to have a page where you can see all the repos where you are admin and its access control.

In my case, some persons left our dev team, and we had some repos where those still had access because we didn't see it in an easy way...

thanx!!! But still it is a great service, keep up with it!
fields.summary: Git access managment

fields.description: when a team using a bind domain, a user join the team, select account->team link, it is a deadlink
fields.summary: when bind a domain, the team link is a deadlink

fields.description:
Right now the landing pages for all of our team's BitBucket repositories is set to the be "Issues". This gives all issues that have ever been reported for the repository. It would be more helpful for it to do what clicking on the Issues tab does - show all issues with a status of new or open.

Would it be possible to add an option for "New/Open Issues" to the choices for the landing page?

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Landing Page - Open Issues (BB-7075)

fields.description: If a user changes their username, the newsfeed no longer shows up for changes committed using the previous username. I do not believe that should be the intended functionality, especially considering it is the same user.
fields.summary: Username Changes Breaks Newsfeed (BB-7081)
Properly indent Pygments code blocks under lists (BB-7079)

fields.description: When linking to a file with a # in the filename, the # is not escaped properly.
fields.summary: Hash symbol (#) is not escaped in source filename URLs (BB-7051)

fields.description: In BitBucket users can send empty message - I think they shouldn't.
fields.summary: Can send empty message (BB-7052)

fields.description:
h2. Current Situation
We have a team for the company. We have dozens of projects now that are being built on our internal Jenkins system. Since all of these projects are private repositories, we need to give each project a deployment key. This is becoming a pain in the butt to have to go and find the right key, and copy it to each and every project. (We have different Jenkins slaves configurations so each project might not get the same ssh deployment key).

h2. Proposal
Make the ability to have a team have a shared ssh deployment key. You add this to the team and every project under that team can now have read only access using this key. This will make life also easier, if say, a key has to change for what ever reason, I won't have to change dozens of project keys.
fields.summary: Share deployment keys among team

fields.description:
Hi,

_Could you explain why the following occurs_.

When adding a file to Project -> Downloads it will be available right away.\\
But, when i override a file with a newer version it takes a long time for those changes to take effect on the server.\\
It sometimes takes a couple of hours for the downloads to update and during this time people whom are trying to download the file get the old cached version.

I understand downloads is not really a feature but more of an extra but i am just curious if this is normal behavior.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Downloads renewal takes ages

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I don't know if it's a feature or a bug, but Email Diff service is not sending emails with diffs, instead it contains e.g. this:

<HgDiff ea7aa2a4ef7b:a60e82e6465f ['rttp-gui-parent/rttp-gui-web-frontend/src/main/webapp/VAADIN/themes/sors-frontend/layouts/privacyPolicy.html']><HgDiff ea7aa2a4ef7b:a60e82e6465f ['rttp-gui-parent/rttp-gui-web-frontend/src/main/webapp/VAADIN/themes/sors-frontend/layouts/terms.html']>
fields.summary: Email Diff service problem

fields.description: What release are we on? I keep seeing 1.5.47 but my EasySMS release is 1.6.2??? the contact photo matching is completely off, they are all over the place. Am I on a beta release and don't know it?
fields.summary: contact pic don't match my phone's

fields.description:
The main problem is that we're finding it difficult to determine if there are any pull requests that require attention.  Currently the only way to achieve this is to open every single repository for the team.

It would be much more usable if we could see if there were open pull requests for any repositories listed on the team's profile page (i.e. https://bitbucket.org/{user/team}/profile/repositories).
fields.summary: Indicate open pull requests in the repository tab for team profiles

fields.description: Like the title says.
fields.summary: Add a broker for Thoughtworks Go (BB-7037)

fields.description:
Hi,

I had the email diff service on my repository (contrail_admin/ctrlplane) for past few months and things were fine (mail with diffs sent to id I had selected). However in past few days I do get email when a commit is pushed but I don't see actual diffs being sent out. Instead I see something like below-

date:        2012-12-31 00:16:58\\
summary:     Make xmpp tests pass again. Move to non-blocking mode

affected #:  2 files

<GitDiff 906f8135c179:082740c9bdc1 ['src/xmpp/xmpp_client.cc']><GitDiff 906f8135c179:082740c9bdc1 ['src/xmpp/xmpp_server.cc']>

Repository URL: https://bitbucket.org/contrail_admin/ctrlplane/
fields.summary: Email Diff service is not working correctly.

fields.description:
Hey,

Just noticed a bug on bitbucket where, from my public profile https://bitbucket.org/rotoudjimaye, anyone can see the teams I am member of, each team with a repository count (either public or private) and members count.

For instance, Team CourageLTD https://bitbucket.org/courageltd has 0 public repositories, while you can see from my profile that they have 7 repos.

Best,

Theophile
fields.summary: Number of private repositories owned by a team hidden on team's profile but visible on members profiles (BB-7044)
Raw commit URL for git changesets renders "GitDiff" object rather than diff (BB-7045)

fields.description: Does not work if theme is changed.
fields.summary: Only works when using the default theme in Thunderbird

fields.description:
Linking to https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Chromium_11_Logo.svg from a Markdown README yields an empty URL ({{<a href="">}}) when rendering on the website.  Rendering the same file at the [Markdown Web Dingus|http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus] yields the expected result.

See [this file|https://bitbucket.org/AluisioASG/crppmgr/src/606074b43ce1d37f4400507ab903c4e5a3d8f77a/Icons/README.md%3Fat%3Ddefault] for an example.
fields.summary: Link in Markdown README gives empty URL

fields.description:
Within the last few days it seems the diffstat api for specific changesets no longer works, it's all returning 0 for added/removed.

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/*youruser*/*yourrepo*/changesets/*changeset*/diffstat
fields.summary: API Diffstats not working

fields.description:
I know it sounds silly to have 10,000+ files, but I have good reasons.  but Bitbucket fails to show the files when I go to browse them.\\
Is there a way to limit the number of files that are to be displayed?  Paging would help greatly.
fields.summary: Repo with 10,000+ files breaks bitbucket (BB-7693)

fields.description: android_nexuss_vendor_google_crespo / proprietary / extract-files.sh
fields.summary: my nexus 7 tablet is under parent system and i am 30 years old, i guess my boyfriend is manageing ma tab's system

fields.description:
Bitbucket advises a branch naming scheme "user/branch".

When I try to download a tarball with the source code of such branch, I get "Internal server error".
fields.summary: Cannot download a branch tarball if there is a slash in the branch name (BB-7047)

fields.description:
Windows Ultimate, x64.\\
Open Hardware Monitor is working fine, but when trying to open OpenHardwareMonitorApplet it reports mfc110u.dll is missing.\\
mfc110u.dll IS in the Windows\system32 folder.\\
Applet was started with Admin Rights.\\
Any suggestions?\\
Thanks, Mark
fields.summary: Missing mfc110u.dll???

fields.description:
When navigating through Bitbucket from time to time Pages are downloaded instead of being rendered.

For example when clicking on the Wiki Page for a Repository The browser starts a download. Clicking it again the browser renders this page. The same goes for almost every link on Bitbucket. This behavior is random and occurs very often which is quite annoying.

It seems that Bitbucket destroys the headers sent to the client. They're saved with the downloaded page (Viewed with vi):

{code}
^_<8b>^H^@^@^@^@^@^@^C^C^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@HTTP/1.1 200 OK^M
Server: nginx/1.2.4^M
Date: Sat, 29 Dec 2012 13:11:20 GMT^M
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8^M
Transfer-Encoding: chunked^M
Connection: keep-alive^M
X-Served-By: bitbucket05^M
Vary: Cookie^M
X-Version: b04dbe374cd4^M
ETag: "261c9f742df3adbd4e1077ada61dc2c7"^M
X-Static-Version: afebfb091096^M
X-Request-Count: 371^M
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=2592000^M
Content-Encoding: gzip^M
^M

{code}
fields.summary: Pages trigger download instead of being rendered in chrome

fields.description: On my own profile's Activity page, I can see commits to all repositories (including repositories not under my own account), but when I look at the page without being logged in, I can only see my own repositories and not the group repositories. All the repositories are public, so I'm not sure I understand the difference. Is this intentional or just a missing feature?
fields.summary: Public activity does not include commits to group repositories

fields.description:
Hi,

I use always a notation in subject of the commit adding the date:

Example: "Release 20121229" <--year 2012 month 12 date 29

But the web page makes a link in this number like this: https://bitbucket.org/my_user_name/my_repo/commits/20121219

Obviously this is not a commit. It's just a bug.

I send you a picture from it.

Kind Regards and Happy New Year!
fields.summary: Strange bug in web page

fields.description:
Since 2012/12/28, EmailDiff does not expand GitDiff.\\
Is it a bug or a changing specification?

BEFORE:

https://bitbucket.org/xxxx/xxxx/changeset/yyyy/\\
changeset:   yyyy\\
branch:      master\\
user:        xxxx\\
date:        2012-12-26 13:10:25\\
summary:     update 2012/12/26

affected #:  1 file

diff --git a/xxxx/xxxx b/xxxx/xxxx\\
index yyyy..yyyy zzzz\\
--- a/xxxx/xxxx\\
+++ b/xxxx/xxxx\\
@@ -18,3 +18,12 @@

AFTER:

https://bitbucket.org/xxxx/xxxx/changeset/yyyy/\\
changeset:   yyyy\\
branch:      master\\
user:        xxxx\\
date:        2012-12-28 01:15:57\\
summary:     daily update

affected #:  1 file

<GitDiff yyyy:zzzz ['xxxx/xxxx']>
fields.summary: EmailDiff does not expand GitDiff (BB-7038)

fields.description:
Viewing the profile of a user who is a member of a team, shows a box with the team name, member count, and repository count.

When viewing the team profile, the repository count displayed is the number of public repositories, but when viewing the member's profile while not being a member, the total count (including private repositories) is displayed instead.
fields.summary: Profile shows # of private repositories for a team (BB-7885)

fields.description: There should be a way to view what repositories a group has some level of access to. This should probably be shown on the account admin somewhere.
fields.summary: Add ability to view the repositories that a group is configured to access (BB-7029)

fields.description:
See attached.

It's supposed to upload a binary of size 9.03 MiB (I believe there are no size limits on BitBucket) and then redirect to custom domain, but it fails with the shown error.
fields.summary: Uploading a binary fails if you use a custom domain (BB-7046)

fields.description:
When we occasionally have an in-development project, the master branch will be empty till we're ready to launch.

Visiting a URL in this format:\\
https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/src

Shows the following message:\\
"The source directory is empty.\\
Get started with your first commit."

There's no quick way to switch branches on that page, to view the develop branch.

I know there are other ways to get the /develop branch to display, but this is a bit unintuitive and the warning message on this screen is confusing to a lot of users.
fields.summary: "The source directory is empty" shown when master branch is empty

fields.description:
When a search is made no commits are found.\\
The pagination is not working too.
fields.summary: Commits can't be found in search

fields.description:
{code}
Administrator@VMLENOVO-F726AA ~/Eigene Dateien/VB6Development (master)
$ git push git@bitbucket.org/dilbert4you/vb6development.git HEAD
fatal: 'git@bitbucket.org/dilbert4you/vb6development.git' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

This failed!
fields.summary: git push over SSH fails with "does not appear to be a git repository"

fields.description:
Followed private repositories still show up in the dashboard/repositories block after removing your access to them.

*Since you do not have access to them anymore, your unable to unfollow the repositories.*

Proper behavior when removing access to a private repository should be to unfollow the repository.

In my case I am still following 5+ private repositories that I removed my access to - which I am unable to access and unfollow now.
fields.summary: Followed repositories still show up in the dashboard as following after removing access to them

fields.description: I like the new username autocomplete pane, but it's annoying when you're writing code blocks in comments or something in a pull request and you start typing something prefixed with {{@}} (like a member variable in CoffeeScript or Ruby or something) and the username autocomplete pops up.

Archlinux i686\\

are still ignored in Version 1.18.1.

Any help possible?

fields.description:
trying to recreate my repo [link removed] and i'm in a redirect loop.

not ideal.

what's more concerning is that i can see this redirect loop when not logged into my bitbucket account.

here's the headers, hopefully they help somehow:

Edit: nevermind - google analytics reveals information about my UA/setup that i'm not comfortable disclosing.
fields.summary: redirect loop while creating repo

fields.description: Today, every pull-request doesn't finish successfully (appears loading image, but not finish it neither shows any message)
fields.summary: Pull-request fails

fields.description:
Hello,

i try to create a repository with the name CMS / Codeigniter,\\
but i have one page that refresh each 5 seconds.\\
I try to acces the repository settings and i have the same page with the message "Please wait a moment while we create your repository." And it's refresh and refresh....

Thank you
fields.summary: Page blocked on creating repository

fields.description:
When creating a new repositorie a loading bar shows and a message with "Please wait a moment while we create your repository." has been doing this for over four minutes. A bug or is it supposed to be this way.

(Sorry, some bad english.)
fields.summary: Creating repositories is stuck...
Unable to create new repository

fields.description: all day we cannot create pull request, it's loading for many hours, but cannot make any pull request
fields.summary: We cannot create any pull requests !!!

fields.description: Hi, I recently created a new repository("pygo on rails") and it is stuck on the "Creating Repository"(with the blue horizontal roller/timer). Whenever I click into it I just get that loading page so I can't even delete it now? Is it because repo names shouldn't have spaces in them? Many thanks for the excellent service.
fields.summary: Creating Repository bug/ issue

fields.description: I have set up some tests regarding POSTs from SERVICES. It appears that these may not be firing. All of our repositories use the POST hook and our logs are showing that bitbucket has not fired one since 12/26. Thank you for looking into this.
fields.summary: Services POST does not appear to be functioning

fields.description: When I click the "Create a Pull Request" button, nothing happens and just the page remains as it is. Please, fix this issue as soon as possible.
fields.summary: PULL REQUEST not working

fields.description: I deleted a repository and wanted to recreate it. After doing so it won't finish the creation process and seems to be stuck.
fields.summary: Repository won't 'create'

fields.description:
A load bar is available when create a new repo from group. This page don't refresh and don't create the repository. There is a loop (reload bar) and don't create/next page to repo.

You can view these two repos:\\
https://bitbucket.org/trytonspain/tryton-account_csv2xml\\
https://bitbucket.org/trytonspain/trytond-account_es
fields.summary: Create repo from group - loop creation a repository

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a pull request to the main repository, after pushing the button "Create pull request" the button is grayed out and the little busy spinner is spinning, but nothing ever happens.

This happens to me and to the other user that usually create pull request to that repository like me.

The pull request is from  lucaminudel/Polipone.Luca to rmarotti/Polipone.\\
The same happens from rmarotti/Polipone.Ric to rmarotti/Polipone.
fields.summary: Pull request hangs

fields.description: After creating new repository (https://bitbucket.org/repo/create, filled Name and Language, type - git) appears page which is attached, after couple of seconds it refreshes, but the message remains - right now the repository is being created for couple of minutes.
fields.summary: Infinite loop while creating new repository

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/tokastas/django_ssrf_worked
fields.summary: "Creating Repository" very long creating

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/gas_pravosudie/django_ssrf
fields.summary: "Repository Unavailable" after striping.

fields.description: In the project larsivi/amber/ I have pushed some wiki pages (see Annotations as an example) via the hg repository. However, when I do this, it does not appear to show up in the overview/timeline like the online wiki edits, even though the pages quite clearly have been added.
fields.summary: Wiki commits via hg repo doesn't show up in timeline (BB-7042)

fields.description: I just tried to create a HTML/CSS git repository and Bitbucket is stuck on "Creating Repository" screen. Constantly refreshing the same screen. I can see the new repo in Repositories drop down but when I click on it, it still redirects me to "Creating Repository" screen.
fields.summary: Stuck in "Creating Repository" screen

fields.description:
Today I noticed that my webhook isn't working anymore.\\
To test it, I added a requestbin url (http://requestb.in/) as a POST service, and pushed a commit: requestbin didn't receive anything.
fields.summary: Webhook not working anymore

fields.description: I am not able to create a Pull Request. When I click on "Create a Pull Request" button, the pull request is not created. Page is not navigated or loaded. Please works on this issue. It is urgent.
fields.summary: Not able to create a Pull Request

fields.description: It is about 3 AM pacific time. I tried making a fork of an existing repository. Original repo https://bitbucket.org/runhello/polyconsole fork repo https://bitbucket.org/runhello/subdivide . I pressed the button a good... 5, 10 minutes ago? Every time I go to the /subdivide page, it says: "Cloning Repository... Please Wait A Minute While We Clone Your Repository" and there's a blue progress bar. If I try to push to /subdivide hg says it does not exist. I can push to my existing repos. I can certainly wait until tomorrow for the clone to complete but it seemed worth reporting.
fields.summary: Can't clone

fields.description: See the attached screen capture -- I triggered a {{hg strip}} on my repository goodtune/avocatennis and it seems to have tripped up somewhere.
fields.summary: A strip process has gone rogue and frozen my repository

fields.description: I tried to update / create pull requests on 2 different repositories and it didnt work. After clicking the 'create' or 'update' button, nothing more happens, the page just stays the same and the pullreqest is not changed / created.
fields.summary: broken pull reqest functionality?

fields.description: When I click the "Follow" button on any issue (or type 'xw') it switches to "Following" for a brief moment before returning to "Follow"
fields.summary: Follow repository link in repository header reverts back to previous state

Hi,

https://bitbucket.org/buenchaval/concursator2000

thank you!

fields.description: There is a bug on profile page, where it shows that there is zero commits on a repository, and even zero followers, even though I do have 2 followers, myself, and my team account, and there is about 36 commits at the time of this bug report. I would be glad to see this fixed in the future, other than that, you are doing a great job with Bitbucket, Atlassian!

Hi,\\

Ilija

fields.description: I think it will be helpful to add a button to empty the Inbox.
fields.summary: Add empty Inbox feature (BB-7013)

#21 said it was resolved however on my repo i get invalid information

Type
    Mercurial
Language
    PHP
Last Updated

The RSS feed shows all commits.
fields.summary: Overview 0 bytes, no commits

fields.description:
GitHub has the feature for custom 404 pages for static page repositories by simply using an HTML file named "404.html" in the root of the repository.

I think this would be a neat and easy feature to implement.
fields.summary: static site repository custom 404 pages (BB-7012)

fields.description:
Most of the repositories on our company's [team page|https://bitbucket.org/internetgroup/] are shown with "0 commits", but they do have commits.

Even when it's not zero, it's wrong: [this project|https://bitbucket.org/internetgroup/vulcano] is shown as having 121 commits when in fact it has 1265 (according to {{git log | grep -c '^commit'}}).
fields.summary: Commit counter is wrong most of the time

fields.description:
The downloads of uploaded files from cdn.bitbucket.org are impossibru slow. I did uploaded 20 MB tarball which is needed for my project to be bulit and the download of https://bitbucket.org/piotrkarbowski/better-initramfs/downloads/aboriginal-1.2.0-x86_64_with_ftw+nftw.tar.bz2 about 30 kBps.

Is this how it supposed to work or its a bug and will be faster?
fields.summary: cdn.bitbucket.org impossibru slow.

fields.description:
We have a fairly long repository name which is partially covered by the clone button.\\
This is purely a cosmetic issue as the link is still clickable and mostly readable, just thought you'd want it brought to your attention.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Long repository names covered by clone button (BB-7041)

fields.description:
In Github, pull requests sent to repo can be accessed via {{refs/pull/123/...}}\\
This enables things like Travis CI to work.\\
I'd like the pull request be reified here, as well, so I can access it from git itself.\\
Also, allow to list pull requests (possibly with filtering for open ones only), but there is BCLOUD-3442 for this.
fields.summary: Repository refs for pull requests

fields.description: no response when I click on Add Key on Ubuntu 12.04
fields.summary: Add Key

fields.description:
I could do this before, but cannot find something clickable to do this after the UI update.

I mean something like https://github.com/explore

With the new UI all I can click and get is just something I already follow, no way to discover more. Tried empty search but no luck.
fields.summary: No link to explore public repos (BB-7015)

fields.description:
Hello,

It would be awesome if you could give users the option to protect their Bitbucket account by using a two-factor authentication system.

It would be epic if you used the Time-based One-time Password (TOTP) algorithm specified in RFC 6238(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238) so it would work with Google Authenticator app for just about every mobile platform.

Thanks for providing a great service!\\
Happy Holidays.
fields.summary: Support two-factor authentication (BB-7016)

fields.description:
Yesterday I've pushed changes to submodule repo and then pushed the reference to latest commit of that submodule repo. But when I tryed to go by the link that referenced latest commit of that submodule repo state I got 404 page with message shown on the attached image.

*UPD:*

* https://bitbucket.org/jeserkin/a - main repo, that has a submodule that references other repo B
* https://bitbucket.org/jeserkin/b - submodule repo, that is referenced
fields.summary: Submodules for some reason stoped working (BB-7048)

fields.description:
Hi,

if you go to the "Repository details" section you can change a lot of things of your repository, like the name, description, and others.

On this page, you can also select the "Language" of your project. The popup menu allows you to choose C, Python, and many other languages. I've discovered Markdown, however, there is no entry for [AsciiDoc|http://www.methods.co.nz/asciidoc/].

Please consider adding AsciiDoc to the "Language" popup.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Support/Add AsciiDoc to Repository Details > Language (BB-7009)

fields.description: There should be a setting that allows to disable notifications about changes that the I myself has done. Why would I want to get my own comments emailed to me? That's really annoying.
fields.summary: Don't notify about self-made changes
Using & in Milestone name breaks the filter

fields.description: When you place any block made with black Xychorite, it will color it with the Grey structure color, not the black structure color.  This is as of 1.4.5, but your changelog did not mention fixing this, so I don't think you fixed it yet based on that.
fields.summary: Black Xychorite color glitched.

fields.description:
Note the number of followers for the CudaTimer repository on my profile page:\\
https://bitbucket.org/ashwin

Now note the number of followers displayed on the CudaTimer repository page:\\
https://bitbucket.org/ashwin/cudatimer

At the time of this writing, the first one says 6 followers, but the second says 1 follower.

These are two different follower counts, one of them should be wrong.
fields.summary: Mismatching number of followers displayed for repository

fields.description: Projects in the bitbucket, but want to put Hudson can support?
fields.summary: whether or not to support Hudson ?

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/Intranel/visionslivemobile/wiki/Release%20Process

I know this page is there because I can see it when I clone the wiki repo.

However when I access it from the browser I get...

Oops, it looks like that file doesn't exist

You can go back Home or create this wiki page.
fields.summary: Can't Access wiki through web page

fields.description:
When you reply using the e-mail from a bitbucket issue, it is displayed correctly as a comment but the accents are not correctly displayed. This is an example (spanish lang):

"Los m=E9dicos de familia son tambi=E9n importantes. Control de pacientes vi= ejos en casa. Y buscan a mucho por Internet."
fields.summary: When replying directly using e-mail (for example gmail) accents are not correctly parsed

fields.description:
Hello team, since a long time I can not access to my rep https://bitbucket.org/burnham/phoenixcata406_bkp

Thanks for your answer.
fields.summary: I can not access to my repo.

fields.description: When viewing diff on a file, I'd like to be able to quickly step through history of that file, without having to manually select the "From" and "To" commits, which is very cumbersome.
fields.summary: Provide a 'diff to previous' link when viewing a file diff to step through its history (BB-7024)

fields.description: Hello, the problem is my screen (10") is too small to show the bitbucket page in its full size, so could you make it responsive to provide an optimal viewing experience—easy reading and navigation with a minimum of resizing, panning, and scrolling?
fields.summary: Responsive UI to support mobile and small screens (BB-7040)

fields.description:
If I'm viewing a specific file, it doesn't make any sense to show all the commits in the "Diff from X to Y" popup menus when many of them may not have affected the file I'm viewing.

If that's not possible, then some visual indication in the popup menu that commit A affected this file but commit B did not affect this file, would be useful.
fields.summary: when viewing diff for a specific file, only the relevant commits should be shown in the comparative popup menus

fields.description:
I commiting to my repositories from two computers and I push some commits before I set up alias for my ssh key. Then I add alias for ssh git key. In commits I saw my bitbucket user, but in overview page it is still only name of git user which create the commit.\\
I would like to see everywhere my bitbcucket user after that I add alias for my user.

Sorry for my bad english.

Thank you
fields.summary: User alias is not changed everywhere
